tabletop: CI/CD Platform and Git Repository Compromise
title: CI/CD & Source Code Breach
description: An attacker gains access to your CI platform and possibly your Git repositories, triggering a serious software supply chain breach.
objectives: Maintain customer trust, verify build integrity, scope code exposure, restore security of development pipelines.
narrative_intro:
Youâ€™re mid-sprint in a normal week. Engineering is pushing hard toward a product milestone. A staging deployment goes out overnight â€” but no one owns the commit. A CI job ran using an unknown token. DevOps starts digging.

Within the hour, it becomes clear: your CI pipeline has been compromised. Logs show access to build artifacts, secret keys, and Git repositories. One production image may have been tampered with. Worse, there's no definitive way to prove which builds are clean. The attacker may have introduced backdoors â€” and your customers are already running the code.

Customers trust your software. Partners embed your binaries. Some of your code may even run in regulated environments. The software factory is broken. How do you lead through this?
